poem:
Title: "An Ode to the Vampire of Arts"

A vampire, the arts may seem to some,
Sucking life's financial blood, they fear.
Yet it's from crimson heartbeats that brilliance come,
Our culture's mortality held dear.
Not a fiend who takes, but an angel who gives,
Each brush stroke, note and line, truly lives.
So feed the arts, let them thrive, not wane,
In their pulse, we find our gain.
